de.mpa.client.ui

Class BarChartHighlighter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jdesktop.swingx.decorator.AbstractHighlighter
      • org.jdesktop.swingx.decorator.PainterHighlighter
        • de.mpa.client.ui.BarChartHighlighter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.jdesktop.swingx.decorator.Highlighter

    public class BarChartHighlighter
extends org.jdesktop.swingx.decorator.PainterHighlighter
    A simple highlighter for displaying numerical table cell values in a bar chart-like fashion.
    Author:
    behne

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BarChartHighlighter()
      Convenience constructor for a bar chart highlighter using a default appearance.
      BarChartHighlighter(Color color)
      Convenience constructor for a bar chart highlighter specifying a single color.
      BarChartHighlighter(Color startColor, Color endColor)
      Convenience constructor for a bar chart highlighter specifying gradient colors.
      BarChartHighlighter(Color startColor, Color endColor, NumberFormat formatter)
      Convenience constructor for a bar chart highlighter specifying gradient colors and a number format.
      BarChartHighlighter(double minValue, double maxValue, int baseline, int orientation, Color startColor, Color endColor)
      Constructs a highlighter painting a rectangular bar filled with a gradient color mapping the value range between minValue and maxValue to a color range from startColor to endColor.
      BarChartHighlighter(double minValue, double maxValue, int baseline, int orientation, Color startColor, Color endColor, NumberFormat formatter)
      Constructs a highlighter painting a rectangular bar filled with a gradient color mapping the value range between minValue and maxValue to a color range from startColor to endColor.
      BarChartHighlighter(double minValue, double maxValue, int baseline, Point2D startPoint, Point2D endPoint, Color startColor, Color endColor, NumberFormat formatter)
      Constructs a highlighter painting a rectangular bar filled with a gradient color mapping the value range between minValue and maxValue to a color range from startColor to endColor.

                           Color endColor)
        Convenience constructor for a bar chart highlighter specifying gradient colors.
        Parameters:
        startColor - The bar's color at its lower end.
        endColor - The bar's color at its upper end.

      • BarChartHighlighter

        public BarChartHighlighter(Color startColor,
                           Color endColor,
                           NumberFormat formatter)
        Convenience constructor for a bar chart highlighter specifying gradient colors and a number format.
        Parameters:
        startColor - The bar's color at its lower end.
        endColor - The bar's color at its upper end.
        formatter - The number format to be used on the text label.

      • BarChartHighlighter

        public BarChartHighlighter(double minValue,
                           double maxValue,
                           int baseline,
                           int orientation,
                           Color startColor,
                           Color endColor)
        Constructs a highlighter painting a rectangular bar filled with a gradient color mapping the value range between minValue and maxValue to a color range from startColor to endColor. Allows painting a text label next to the bar with a specified baseline width.
        Parameters:
        minValue - The minimum value above which the bar gets painted at all.
        maxValue - The maximum value to which the bar height will be scaled.
        baseline - The pixel width of the text label.
        orientation - The orientation of the bar. Either SwingConstants.HORIZONTAL or SwingConstants.VERTICAL.
        startColor - The bar's color at its lower end.
        endColor - The bar's color at its upper end.

      • BarChartHighlighter

        public BarChartHighlighter(double minValue,
                           double maxValue,
                           int baseline,
                           int orientation,
                           Color startColor,
                           Color endColor,
                           NumberFormat formatter)
        Constructs a highlighter painting a rectangular bar filled with a gradient color mapping the value range between minValue and maxValue to a color range from startColor to endColor. Allows painting a text label next to the bar with a specified baseline width and a specified decimal formatter.
        Parameters:
        minValue - The minimum value above which the bar gets painted at all.
        maxValue - The maximum value to which the bar height will be scaled.
        baseline - The pixel width of the text label.
        orientation - The orientation of the bar.
        startColor - The bar's color at its lower end.
        endColor - The bar's color at its upper end.
        formatter - The number format to be used on the text label.

                           double maxValue,

                           Point2D startPoint,

                           Color endColor,
                           NumberFormat formatter)
        Constructs a highlighter painting a rectangular bar filled with a gradient color mapping the value range between minValue and maxValue to a color range from startColor to endColor. Allows painting a text label next to the bar with a specified baseline width and a specified decimal formatter.
        Parameters:
        minValue - The minimum value above which the bar gets painted at all.
        maxValue - The maximum value to which the bar height will be scaled.
        baseline - The pixel width of the text label.
        startPoint -
        endPoint -
        startColor - The bar's color at its lower end.
        endColor - The bar's color at its upper end.
        formatter - The number format to be used on the text label.

    • Method Detail

      • getBaseline

        public int getBaseline()
        Returns the text label's pixel width. Can be 0 to not display any text at all.
        Returns:
        The baseline.
